name: (3-nitrophenyl)[(5E)-4-phenyl-5-(phenylhydrazono)-4,5-dihydro-1,3,4-thiadiazol-2-yl]methanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1056
Reason: 3-Nitrophenyl group: The 3-nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular interactions and melting point by approximately +50°C. Phenyl group (2 phenyls): The two phenyl groups significantly enhance the melting point due to their ability to form rigid structures and increase molecular weight. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. 1-methyl-4-phenyl-1,3,5-thiadiazol-2-one: The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. The phenyl group (1 phenyl) can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
